docs.title: Project Name
docs.text:
Welcome to the Project Name documentation.

This is a Python project template designed to help you quickly bootstrap new Python projects with best practices baked in.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Modern Python: Built for Python 3.13+
  • Dependency Management: Uses uv for fast, reliable dependency management
  • Code Quality: Pre-configured with Ruff, Pyright, and pre-commit hooks
  • Testing: Pytest setup with sensible defaults
  • Documentation: MkDocs with Material theme and auto-generated API docs

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# Clone the template
git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/project-name.git
cd project-name

# Install dependencies
uv sync

# Run tests
uv run pytest

# Start documentation server
uv sync --group docs
uv run mkdocs serve

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
project-name/
├── src/project_name/     # Main application code
│   ├── config/           # Configuration management
│   ├── data_models/      # Pydantic models
│   ├── metaclasses/      # Custom metaclasses
│   └── params/           # Parameters and paths
├── tests/                # Test suite
├── docs/                 # Documentation (you are here)
├── scratch_space/        # Experimental notebooks
└── meta/                 # Project renaming utilities

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Getting Started - Set up your development environment
  • Guides - Learn about the tools used in this project
  • API Reference - Explore the codebase
  • Contributing - How to contribute to this project

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to this project!

docs.title: Development Setup
docs.text:
1. Fork and clone the repository
  2. Install dependencies: uv sync --group dev
  3. Install pre-commit hooks: uv run pre-commit install

docs.title: Code Style
docs.text:
This project uses:

  • Ruff for linting and formatting
  • Pyright for type checking
  • Pre-commit hooks for automated checks

docs.title: Style Guidelines
docs.text:
# ✅ Good: Clear typing, early returns, descriptive names
from loguru import logger as lg

def fetch_entity(table: str, entity_id: str | None) -> dict:
    if entity_id is None:
        msg = "entity_id required"
        raise ValueError(msg)

    lg.info(f"Fetching {entity_id} from {table}")
    return {"id": entity_id, "table": table}

docs.title: Pull Request Process
docs.text:
1. Create a feature branch from main
  2. Make your changes with clear, focused commits
  3. Ensure all tests pass: uv run pytest
  4. Ensure code quality checks pass: uv run ruff check . && uv run pyright
  5. Update documentation if needed
  6. Submit a pull request

docs.title: Commit Messages
docs.text:
Use conventional commit style:

type(scope): description

feat(config): add environment variable validation
fix(params): handle missing path gracefully
docs(readme): update installation instructions
test(models): add edge case coverage

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
• Write tests for new functionality
  • Place tests in tests/ mirroring the src/ structure
  • Use descriptive test names: test_function_does_expected_behavior
# Run all tests
uv run pytest

# Run with coverage
uv run pytest --cov=src/project_name

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
• Update docs when adding new features
  • Include usage examples in docstrings
  • Build and preview locally: uv run mkdocs serve

docs.title: Questions?
docs.text: Open an issue for any questions or concerns.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide will help you set up your development environment and get started with the project.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.13+
  • uv package manager

docs.title: 1. Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/project-name.git
cd project-name

docs.title: 2. Install Dependencies
docs.text:
# Install all dependencies (including dev tools)
uv sync --group dev

# Or install specific groups
uv sync --group test    # Testing only
uv sync --group lint    # Linting only
uv sync --group docs    # Documentation only

docs.title: 3. Verify Installation
docs.text:
# Run tests
uv run pytest

# Check code style
uv run ruff check .

# Type checking
uv run pyright

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
uv run pytest
uv run pytest -v              # Verbose output
uv run pytest tests/config/   # Run specific test directory

docs.title: Code Quality
docs.text:
# Lint and format
uv run ruff check .
uv run ruff format .

# Type checking
uv run pyright

docs.title: Pre-commit Hooks
docs.text:
Pre-commit hooks are configured to run automatically on each commit:

# Install hooks (first time only)
uv run pre-commit install

# Run manually on all files
uv run pre-commit run --all-files

docs.title: Environment Configuration
docs.text:
The project expects environment variables to be stored in ~/cred/project_name/.env.

Security

Never commit .env files or secrets to the repository.

docs.title: Building Documentation
docs.text:
# Install docs dependencies
uv sync --group docs

# Start local server with hot reload
uv run mkdocs serve

# Build static site
uv run mkdocs build

docs.title: Renaming the Project
docs.text:
Use the included renaming utility to customize the project for your needs:

uv run rename-project

See the meta README for detailed instructions.

docs.title: Manually check the latest release versions
docs.text:
1. open the repo link
  2. go to releases
  3. get the latest stable version

For * pre-commit hooks versions * yelp detect-secrets

docs.title: Match the uv versions of the tools
docs.text:
1. update the tool with uv
  2. run the command to get the version
  3. update the rev in this file (note that some revs have a "v" prefix)

For * uv itself * ruff * pyright * nbstripout

docs.title: Dependencies group
docs.text:
To add a package to a specific group, use the --group option:

uv add --group lint ruff

docs.title: Upgrade packages
docs.text:
Upgrades the lock, but not the dependencies in pyproject.toml.

uv add --dev --upgrade-package pyright "pyright[nodejs]"

If you want to upgrade the dependencies in pyproject.toml, use:

uv add --dev "pyright[nodejs]>=1.2.3"

If you want to upgrade the lock for all packages, use:

uv lock --upgrade
uv sync

docs.title: project_name.data_models.basemodel_kwargs
docs.text:
Base model which can be converted to dict at only the top level of attributes.

Useful to send config values using **config.to_kw() to functions.

Classes:

  • BaseModelKwargs –

    Base model with to_kw method.

docs.title: BaseModelKwargs
docs.text:
Bases: BaseModel

Base model with to_kw method.

Methods:

  • to_kw –

    Convert the model to a dictionary, flattening any 'kwargs' attribute.

docs.title: to_kw
docs.text:
to_kw(*, exclude_none: bool = False) -> dict

Convert the model to a dictionary, flattening any 'kwargs' attribute.

Parameters:

  • exclude_none (bool, default: False ) –

    Whether to exclude None values. Defaults to False.

Source code in src/project_name/data_models/basemodel_kwargs.py 
def to_kw(
    self,
    *,
    exclude_none: bool = False,
) -> dict:
    """Convert the model to a dictionary, flattening any 'kwargs' attribute.

    Args:
        exclude_none (bool): Whether to exclude None values. Defaults to False.
    """
    base_dict = (
        {k: v for k, v in self if v is not None} if exclude_none else dict(self)
    )

    # Flatten kwargs if it exists and is a dict
    if "kwargs" in base_dict:
        kwargs_value = base_dict.pop("kwargs")
        if isinstance(kwargs_value, dict):
            # Filter None values from kwargs if exclude_none is True
            if exclude_none:
                kwargs_filtered = {
                    k: v for k, v in kwargs_value.items() if v is not None
                }
                base_dict.update(kwargs_filtered)
            else:
                base_dict.update(kwargs_value)
        else:
            # Put kwargs back if it's not a dict
            base_dict["kwargs"] = kwargs_value

    return base_dict

docs.title: __call__
docs.text:
__call__(*args, **kwargs)

Singleton instance creation.

Source code in src/project_name/metaclasses/singleton.py 
def __call__(cls, *args, **kwargs):  # noqa: ANN002, ANN003, ANN204
    """Singleton instance creation."""
    if cls not in cls._instances:
        cls._instances[cls] = super().__call__(*args, **kwargs)
    return cls._instances[cls]

def __str__(self) -> str:
    """Return the string representation of the object."""
    s = "ProjectNameParams:"
    s += f"\n{self.paths}"
    s += f"\n{self.sample}"
    return s

docs.title: __str__
docs.text:
__str__() -> str

Return the string representation of the object.

Source code in src/project_name/params/project_name_paths.py 
def __str__(self) -> str:
    """Return the string representation of the object."""
    s = "ProjectNamePaths:\n"
    s += f"   src_fol: {self.src_fol}\n"
    s += f"  root_fol: {self.root_fol}\n"
    s += f" cache_fol: {self.cache_fol}\n"
    s += f"  data_fol: {self.data_fol}\n"
    s += f"static_fol: {self.static_fol}\n"
    return s.rstrip()

docs.title: load_common_config_pre
docs.text:
load_common_config_pre() -> None

Pre load the common config.

Source code in src/project_name/params/project_name_paths.py 
def load_common_config_pre(self) -> None:
    """Pre load the common config."""
    # src folder of the package
    self.src_fol = Path(project_name.__file__).parent
    # root folder of the project repository
    self.root_fol = self.src_fol.parents[1]
    # cache
    self.cache_fol = self.root_fol / "cache"
    # data
    self.data_fol = self.root_fol / "data"
    # static
    self.static_fol = self.root_fol / "static"

docs.title: load_config
docs.text:
load_config() -> None

Load the config for data folders.

Source code in src/project_name/params/project_name_paths.py 
def load_config(self) -> None:
    """Load the config for data folders."""
    self.load_common_config_pre()

    s += f"\n  nested_model_some_str: {self.nested_model_some_str}"

docs.title: to_config
docs.text:
to_config() -> SampleConfig

Convert params to config.

Source code in src/project_name/params/sample_params.py 
def to_config(self) -> SampleConfig:
    """Convert params to config."""
    return SampleConfig(
        some_int=self.some_int,
        nested_model=NestedModel(
            some_str=self.nested_model_some_str,
        ),
        kwargs=self.custom_kwargs,
    )
